reference.title: Enabling and Disabling Auto-Failover
reference.shortdesc: Auto-failover is enabled and disabled by means of the POST /settings/autoFailover HTTP method and URI.

section.title: HTTP method and URI
section.p: The auto-failover setting is global, and therefore applies to all nodes in the cluster. Setting-changes require authentication.

ul.li: enabled=[true|false]. Enables or disables automatic failover. Default setting is false.
timeout=number-of-seconds. Integer between 5 and 3600. Specifies the number of seconds that must elapse, with a node unavailable, before automatic failover is triggered. Default setting is 120.

maxCount=number-of-events. Specifies the number of auto-failover events that are handled before user intervention is required. an event might consist of, say, one node failing over; or alternatively, an entire Server Group failing over. The maximum allowed value is three. The default value is one. This parameter is only supported by Couchbase Server Enterprise Edition.

failoverServerGroup=[true|false]. Enables or disables automatic failover for server groups. Do not enable failover for server groups unless you have set up three of more server groups, and have the capacity to absorb the load of any failed-over group. This parameter is ignored if the value of the enabled parameter for automatic failover is false. Default setting is false. This parameter is only supported by Couchbase Server Enterprise Edition.

failoverOnDataDiskIssues[enabled]=[true|false]&failoverOnDataDiskIssues[timePeriod]=number-of-seconds. Integer between 5 and 3600. Enables automatic failover to occur when disk read-write attempts have failed continuously throughout at least 60% of a specied time-period; or disables automatic failover from so occuring. The default enablement-value is false. If the enablement-value is set to true, the default timePeriod is 120 seconds. If the enablement-value is false and the timePeriod is explicitly specified, an error is returned. This parameter and its values are ignored if the value of the enabled parameter for automatic failover is false. This parameter is only supported by Couchbase Server Enterprise Edition.

section.title: Example
section.codeblock: POST /settings/autoFailover HTTP/1.1 Host: 10.5.2.54:8091 Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded Authorization: Basic YWRtaW46YWRtaW4= Content-Length: 14 enabled=true&timeout=600

section.title: Response codes
section.codeblock: HTTP/1.1 200 OK Server: Couchbase Server Pragma: no-cache Date: Sat, 18 Oct 2014 00:26:28 GMT Content-Length: 0 Cache-Control: no-cache

400 Bad Request, The value of "enabled" must be true or false 400 Bad Request, The value of "timeout" must be a positive integer in a range from 5 to 3600 400 Bad Request, The value of "failoverOnDataDiskIssues[timePeriod]" must be a positive integer in a range from 5 to 3600 401 Unauthorized This endpoint isn't available yet.
